userreviews.userReview: A refreshing romance with wit and more twists and turns than a snakes mating ball.Loved it! Never thought I'd run across a zombie who'd win my heart over, but this story had one.

I've really enjoyed Aleah's other books so couldn't wait for this new series. I was not disappointed. I would describe Dead Sexy as True Blood meets The Walking Dead. A few years ago an infection spread through our land that caused a vast part of the population to fall and rise again. Now the undead are asking for their rights to uh - 'life', liberty, and the right to a fair job.  Gemma Sinclair works for her family's funeral home and hunts rogue zombies on the side. She is fun, feisty, and a fighter. She is forced to team up with Mr. 'Hottie McNoPulse', an agent from the Department of Undead Americans, to try and find out why undead Americans are going missing. Unfortunately, DS Thomas Conroy has her pulse racing in more ways than one. To Gemma the initials DS only stand for one thing - Dead Sexy. He is smart, has an intriguing history, and doesn't like to be pushed around.  I received an ARC of this story in exchange for a review. I would have given one anyway as I loved this book and can't wait for the next. I really enjoyed the secondary characters as well. I am looking forward to finding out more about DS, Gemma, and her mother in the next books.

I love this story. At first I thought I was a little bias because I mostly love anything zombie but then I realized that's not it. It is funny, sexy, and had a great plot (plus there is the zombie).From the beginning I liked Gemma and D.S. She's a buttkicking hunter and he's an undead agent for the goverment. He's a hottie flirt and she's confused about being turned on by a zombie.They meet when Gemma stun guns him not knowing he's an agent. He asks for her help in an investigation in her city of Detroit.I love their relationship. The back and forth insults and flirting are funny and great.The storyline is good too, I would never had guessed who the guy they was searching for was. What happened at the end I did see coming but he also hinted at it a few times.It doesn't end in a cliffhanger but there is unanswered questions.One thing that I don't think will be addressed and its just driving me nuts is why D.S. grabbed Gemma from behind when he got to her funeral home? Did he not realize that of course she would attack.I'm anxiously awaiting Dead Set.I was given an eArc by the author in exchange for a honest review. Thank you.

Hands up, this is the first undead or zombie book I've read, but I intrigued enough to want to read more--thank you Aleah Barley.Fluid writing, plenty of action, sufficient intrigue for me to suspect something 'more' is going to unfold through the series, I'm a convert!

4.5 Stars...This book was a first for me...I generally do not like books that have to do with Zombies, but Aleah has this awesome ability to write across genres and bring a story together that just draws you in.
Definitely not your typical zombie story. It was action packed with a kick ass heroine and a seriously sexy undead hero. Witty and very entertaining, I'm looking forward to reading the next book.

I wasn't sure about this book . . . the blurb was good and I'm as much of a fan of Zombie Apocalypse as the next girl but I just wasn't sure about people back from the dead who were functioning members of society . . .Little things kept bugging me all the way through this. It was really inconsistent, first she mentions Biters can't vote but later states that they need their undead ID to register to vote, she refers to biters driving round the city and than later states they can't drive as their reflexes are impaired by necrosis, there's also some to-ing and fro-ing about Biters sense of smell and a couple of other things, it's irritating that the author can't seem to remember her own rules.It also bugged me that Gemma keeps telling us how she kicks ass and takes names. Seriously, she says this about herself at least three times . . . Apart from all of this - and the thing about the romantic interest being dead (creepy whichever way you paint it), I liked this book. It was funny, the dialogue was snappy and the whole book was a little Ilona Andrews-esque. Not sure if I'll read more of this series, I'm not certain I can get passed the dead people walking (I like my Zombies to be mindless and monstrous and in need of killing), but if I do it won't be straight away. I'd probably read something else by the author though.

When I first heard about Dead Sexy by Aleah Barley I was intrigued and eager to read it, so when I got the chance to read an ARC from the publisher in exchange for a review, I jumped at it.After reading this story, I’m so glad that I did, because it was wonderful. This was my first Zombie book. I’ve seen many a Zombie movie and TV show, and I have been a fan of the paranormal genre for years, but had yet to read a book about Zombies. Now, after reading this book I cannot wait to read the next one.The main character Gemma is the kind of girl that every girl really wants to be, she’s tough and funny and pretty in that way that she doesn’t see it herself, and she can kick Biter butt with the best of them.Then D.S. comes along and starts to change her views on what and who Zombies and really be. He’s unexpected in the best way possible and the kind of guy that every girl wants to be with.This book was fast paced and never let up and left me wanting the next book, in this sure to be phenomenal series, right now! This was the first book I have read from this author, but it will not be the last, not by a long shot.I give it a 5 out of 5 stars because that’s the highest it lets you go. :)

I received an ARC of Dead Sexy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review!Upon receiving this book I couldn't wait to dive into it. The topic of zombies have always been intriguing to me and I love all of the unique books that are coming out. Dead Sexy is an amazing read and had me hooked right from the start. It's funny, it's sexy, and I just couldn't get enough! The main character, Gemma Sinclair, is mouthy, feisty, courageous, and bighearted - exactly what I love in a heroine! Then you go and add in the mysterious and sexy D.S. - I am in love! The story-line is wonderfully unique and the author has a way of writing that, whether you are a fan of zombies or not, you will have have trouble putting this down. Take it from me . . . within four hours of reading the first chapter I found myself finished and eagerly looking online for information on the next book in this series! I highly recommend this book to everyone! This is definitely a series I will be keeping an eye on!

Excellent fast read. Excellent story flow. Excellent character builds. This story had a very well thought out balance of mystery, action, suspense and well fleshed out intimate scenes. The main character is a female, independent, self reliant, witty and strong. Her love interest is a sexy man who is more then just a man, he has a personality that I wasn't expecting given what I know about the story. I was given the opportunity to read this story as a beta version and I missed a fair amount of details due to the many distractions I get. I'm glad I reread the released edition from start to finish in under two days. If your reading this review and you like urban fantasy then this book is for you. Yes there are zombies, yes there are rotten humans and yes there are normal decent people that make up this urban fantasy and if you like all that with some extra "spices" wink wink thrown in then pick this book up. Also I cant wait for book two book this ending was delicious and I want more.

I received an advance reader copy of Aleah Barley's Dead Sexy. The novel is so much like it's male lead, D.S. It's funny, sexy, charming, and rough around the edges. It's a hell of a ride, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys Janet Evanovich's butt-kicking bounty hunter Stephanie Plum. Gemma is a girl with her head screwed on straight, except when her hormones get the best of her from the smoking-hot D.S. She kicks butt and takes names. Her family is a hoot (with a stark contrast from her straight laced mother to her biter uncle). The plot and the world that she's crafted is smart and wicked fun. There were a few rough patches, but they won't keep me from buying a copy for myself when the book hits shelves later this week.

What a great book!! This was the first time I have read a book by Aleah Barley and it will definitely not be my last! The book is set in Detroit in a time with Biters, Zombies and Humans all living together but in a time that is not harmonious. Gemma Sinclair works for her family's mortuary but also takes side jobs catching Biters. While on a job she meets the mysterious D.S. and sparks and tension fly! The two work together to find out why Biters have been disappearing from Detroit.Gemma is tough and gets herself into many situations where it shows her limits - which I like!I urge you to give the book a try! It's worth it if you are into paranormal!!

I received an advanced reader copy of Dead Sexy by Aleah Barley. I love zombies, but do not normally read paranormal anything. This tale might have converted me. The idea of humans and the undead living side by side intrigues me and the fact that they would demand rights, great idea! Aleah’s characters are strongly written and her plots are quite innovative.Gemma is a strongly written character, feisty with the ability to kick rogue zombie ass. Our hero, undead, but is pulse poundingly sexy, with an interesting past. Just enough history to cause our heroine to rethink what she thought she knew. Looking forward to the answers Dead Set will reveal.

This was more intense and violent than I usually care to read, but it hooked me in and I enjoyed it. The "bad guy" was obvious before the end of the story, but the many threads of who was a monster and who wasn't really kept my interest. If you are a zombie, through no fault of your own, how should you be treated? How does the family who loves you react? What if you are romantically attracted to a zombie? I already have the second book, although I may skip through the more violent parts.

I did not see this coming. Not much of a fan of zombies who can act like a human but this book really flipped me to the other side! Aside from the MC being a Mortuary attendant, you don't get to read many of novels who stun guns the dead. Add fuel to the fire, the LI is a zombie federal agent. Yikes. But it was entertaining.

4 - 4.5 starsDefinitely worth .99, Dead Sexy is a fast-paced read with an engaging protagonist. I have lots of questions about the zombie plague as it relates to this series - maybe they well be answered in the next book. There are some irritating editing issues that pulled me out of the story; hopefully they'll be cleaned up for the second book in the series.full review soon

This was an awesome book. The story just takes you away and is defiantly different then any books I have read about zombies. All I can say is the next book needs to hurry up and get finished. This book is defiantly worth buying and reading. Lisa Jo

I read this in one sitting! Aleah Barley is quickly becoming one of my favorite authors! I love her sexy characters, her humor and snark and the comedy of errors that plague her heroine. This is one series that I will want all of in paperback and on my kindle!
Aside from the occasional typos and frequently misplaced commas, I really liked this one. It has a nice spin on zombies. I'll be looking for book 2. (3.5 stars)
Not bad. Looking forward to the next book.

description: Mortuary attendant Gemma Sinclair hunts zombies for a living. It's messy work, but it pays the bills... right up until she stun guns the wrong dead man in the ass.Now to keep her family business going, Gemma's forced into a partnership with federal agent D.S. Thomas Conroy. Zombies are disappearing all over town, and he needs Gemma's help to figure out why. With a villain on her trail and a gang of zombies ready to attack, Gemma's just glad her backup is dead sexy...
title:
Dead Sexy
      
          (Dead Sexy #1)
